fields.value: Perioperative temperature in transcatheter aortic valve replacement procedures

dsDescriptionValue.value:
NAME OF DATA SET: Perioperative temperature in transcatheter aortic valve replacement procedures.


NAMES OF CREATORS: Benjamin Rohrer, Emily Penick, Farhad Zahedi, Hocine Tighiouart, Brian Kelly, Frederick Cobey, Stefan Ianchulev.


This data is intended to accompany the manuscript of the original research article titled "Comparison of forced-air and water-circulating warming for prevention of hypothermia during transcatheter aortic valve replacement" by the above mentioned authors. This manuscript is pending publication at PLOS ONE at the time of submission.

publicationCitation.value: Rohrer B, Penick E, Zahedi F, Tighiouart H, Kelly B, Cobey F, et al. (2017) Comparison of forced-air and water-circulating warming for prevention of hypothermia during transcatheter aortic valve replacement. PLoS ONE 12(6): e0178600. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0178600

files.description: This spreadsheet contains the anesthesia duration, procedure duration, amounts of crystalloid and colloid intravenous fluids given intraoperatively, and amounts of blood products used intraoperatively. The specific blood products examined are packed red blood cells, fresh frozen plasma, cryoprecipitate, and platelets. This file additionally contains recorded blood loss (if any), intraoperative blood loss, and cell saver volume (if used). Data are summarized in the sheet "Table 1".
files.label: TAVR Intraoperative variables.xlsx

dataFile.description: This spreadsheet contains the anesthesia duration, procedure duration, amounts of crystalloid and colloid intravenous fluids given intraoperatively, and amounts of blood products used intraoperatively. The specific blood products examined are packed red blood cells, fresh frozen plasma, cryoprecipitate, and platelets. This file additionally contains recorded blood loss (if any), intraoperative blood loss, and cell saver volume (if used). Data are summarized in the sheet "Table 1".

files.description: This spreadsheet contains intraoperative temperature data from 80 patients undergoing transcatheter aortic valve replacement under general anesthesia, 46 and 34 of which were warmed intraoperatively with a convective forced-air and a conductive water-circulating warming device, respectively. It additionally contains first recorded temperature upon arrival to the Cardiothoracic Intensive Care Unit after surgery ("Temp CTU"), first recorded intraoperative temperature ("Temp 1"), lowest recorded intraoperative temperature ("Temp L"), and last recorded intraoperative temperature ("Temp E"), as well as the following background data for each patient: age, body surface area, height, weight, and surgical approach used (transfemoral or transapical).
files.label: TAVR Perioperative temperature data.tab

dataFile.description: This spreadsheet contains intraoperative temperature data from 80 patients undergoing transcatheter aortic valve replacement under general anesthesia, 46 and 34 of which were warmed intraoperatively with a convective forced-air and a conductive water-circulating warming device, respectively. It additionally contains first recorded temperature upon arrival to the Cardiothoracic Intensive Care Unit after surgery ("Temp CTU"), first recorded intraoperative temperature ("Temp 1"), lowest recorded intraoperative temperature ("Temp L"), and last recorded intraoperative temperature ("Temp E"), as well as the following background data for each patient: age, body surface area, height, weight, and surgical approach used (transfemoral or transapical).
